snippet: Workers at the digital media outlet made headlines with their decision to form a union, but they say they are simply looking for a way to provide some stability in a turbulent industry.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column examines successful effort by Gawker employees to form a union, first for a large digital media outlet; observes that most employees sought union as a way of obtaining stability in turbulent industry that was racked by layoffs during Great Recession and ongoing recovery.
lead_paragraph: Workers at the digital media outlet made headlines with their decision to form a union, but they say they are simply looking for a way to provide some stability in a turbulent industry.

headline.print_headline: Striving for a New Kind of Union in a New Economy
headline.main: At Gawker Media, New Economy Workers Strive to Form a New Kind of Union
